title: Pompeo Pozzi
text:
Pompeo Pozzi (1817–1888) was an <a href="Italian%20people">Italian</a> <a href="painter">painter</a>, but is best known for his <a href="photograph">photograph</a>s.
Pozzi studied at the <a href="Brera%20Academy">Brera Academy</a> of Art, and was a resident of <a href="Milan">Milan</a>. He mainly painted <a href="wikt%3Aalpine">alpine</a> <a href="Landscape%20painting">landscapes</a> and <a href="seascape">seascape</a>s. 
The painter <a href="Luigi%20Sacchi">Luigi Sacchi</a> in 1859 began publishing an art and photography magazine titled "L Artista" from Pozzi's studio. Many of Pozzi's photographs are now at the <a href="Biblioth%C3%A8que%20Nationale%20de%20France">Bibliothèque Nationale de France</a> and the <a href="%C3%89cole%20Nationale%20Sup%C3%A9rieure%20des%20Beaux-Arts">École Nationale Supérieure des Beaux-Arts</a> in Paris.
